title: A quick guide to taking awesome screenshots
author: ACB

items.content: An important part of taking incredible screenshots is to find the perfect setting for your picture. Whether that be a valley or a mountain, an ocean or even a flat area, a great setting is an absolute must

This screenshots is basic yet works wonders. The important part is the setting.
Have a good setting, get a good picture.
I’m going to refer to that previous image again, as it makes use of the Minotaur heavy exocraft as it’s focal point. Getting it right means the difference between a bad screenshot and a great one
Let’s analyse this one. On the right is a starship’s nose, this acts like a second focal point. As you might expect, the planet in the distance is the main focal point for several reasons

What you are seeing here is the “Rule of Thirds.” The focal point is the wolf as it is on the interconnected thirds, providing a pleasing aesthetic. Looking at my screenshots, the rule of thirds is evident

The planet draws you attention because it fits well with the background of space.
How? 
The colours are similar in detail, and are thus pleasing to the eye.
As you might expect, Photo Mode has a variety of colour effects, e.g. Vintage or Filmic. Use these to your advantage as they can change a dull photo into an incredible pne

If you go to the settings menu, and switch to -Lens- (in photo mode of course) you should see a setting labelled “Depth Of Field”. This setting blurs objects far in the background and close to the camera in the foreground. This makes a bland, 2D screenshots seem more alive and almost 3D

sections.heading: And with that, you’ll be well on your way to being a master virtual photographer!
